1.brief: above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
watch, i.e. the act (custody), or (concretely) the sentry, the post; objectively preservation, or (concretely) safe; figuratively observance, i.e. (abstractly) duty or (objectively) a usage or party
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
to place (any thing so as to stay); reflexively, to station, offer, continue
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
something hemming in, i.e. (objectively) a mound (of besiegers), (abstractly) a siege, (figuratively) distress; or (subjectively) a fastness
properly, to lean forward, i.e. to peer into the distance; by implication, to observe, await
to see, literally or figuratively (in numerous applications, direct and implied, transitive, intransitive and causative)

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
perhaps properly, to arrange; but used figuratively (of words), to speak; rarely (in a destructive sense) to subdue

properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
to turn back (hence, away) transitively or intransitively, literally or figuratively (not necessarily with the idea of return to the starting point); generally to retreat; often adverbial, again
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
chastisement; figuratively (by words) correction, refutation, proof (even in defence)

2.brief: properly, to eye or (generally) to heed, i.e. pay attention; by implication, to respond; by extension to begin to speak; specifically to sing, shout, testify, announce
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to grave, by implication, to write (describe, inscribe, prescribe, subscribe)
a sight (mentally), i.e. a dream, revelation, or oracle
to dig; by analogy, to engrave; figuratively, to explain
above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications
probably meaning to glisten; a tablet (as polished), of stone, wood or metal
properly, heed, i.e. purpose; used only adverbially, on account of (as a motive or an aim), teleologically, in order that
to run (for whatever reason, especially to rush)
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)

properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
a sight (mentally), i.e. a dream, revelation, or oracle

properly, an appointment, i.e. a fixed time or season; specifically, a festival; conventionally ayear; by implication, an assembly (as convened for a definite purpose); technically the congregation; by extension, the place of meeting; also a signal (as appointed beforehand)
to puff, i.e. blow with the breath or air; hence, to fan (as a breeze), to utter, to kindle (a fire), to scoff
an extremity; adverbially (with prepositional prefix) after
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to lie (i.e. deceive), literally or figuratively
used very widely as demonstrative, lo!; interrogative, whether?; or conditional, if, although; also Oh that!, when; hence, as a negative, not
properly, to question or hesitate, i.e. (by implication) to be reluctant
properly, to adhere to; hence, to await
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
to go or come (in a wide variety of applications)
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to loiter (i.e. be behind); by implication to procrastinate

to be straight or even; figuratively, to be (causatively, to make) right, pleasant, prosperous
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
literally firmness; figuratively security; morally fidelity
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive

elated; hence, arrogant

to rest (as at home); causatively (through the implied idea of beauty ), to celebrate (with praises)
